Steam Big Picture

About This Game

The fan-favorite 2D brawler is back as ex-mob hit man Shank returns to action in Shank 2. With those closest to him under attack, Shank is once again forced on the offensive. Now he must put his trusty arsenal of handguns, shotguns, automatic weapons, chainsaws, machetes, grenades, plus all-new weaponry and moves to use in order to protect those close to him. The original game set a new standard for its visual style and Shank 2 raises the bar. Shank 2 expands on the original game’s amazing combat system to redefine the 2D side-scrolling brawler.

KEY FEATURES

  • Multi-Weapon Combat System: With a brand new redesigned weapon system, take on smarter and greater variety of goons and bigger, badder bosses with new weapon combos and new counter moves that let you use enemies’ weapons against them!
  • It Takes More than One to Survive: Team up with a friend to put a thrashing on hordes of goons in this all-new and incredibly fun arcade-style co-op survival mode. Teamwork is essential to surviving waves of increasing tenacious enemies!
  • Rich Environments: Look for opportunities to bring down ceilings, explode barrels, hurl crates, and explore surroundings to find new in-game unlockables!
  • Stunning Visuals: Shank 2 draws you into the action with a stunning visual style that sets a new benchmark in 2D brawlers.
READ MORE

15 of 15 people (100%) found this review helpful

1 person found this review funny
Metsakurat
755 products in account
37 reviews
Recommended
12.7 hrs on record
Posted: October 5
Shank 2 is a 2D side-scrolling action beat 'em up published by the hated Electronic Arts.
The developers, however, are known for making great games such as "Mark of The Ninja" and "Don't Starve".

You play as Shank. No, You do not play as a knife. (Shank - Prison slang for a homemade knife) Shank is the name of our fearless protagonist.
As Shank you can unlock and use various weapons that fall into two categories: Melee and ranged.
You can dual-wield pistols, blast multiple enemies with a shotgun or strike fear into the hearts of your enemies with a chainsaw.
There are also sections where you get your hands on a minigun and oh god is it fun to just let it rip and watch the massacre take place in front of your very eyes.
Shank is relentless and knows no mercy.

You can rack up combo-chains by launching your enemies into the air, shooting them and just being creative by using your surrounding enviroment such as holes for an example.
You can also pick up explosives such as grenades and molotov cocktails.

The gameplay is faster and more responsive than in the previous title making Shank 2 a bit more enjoyable. The only thing bad about the game and what also makes it worse than the previous title is that there is no co-op campaign anymore. Instead of that we get a new two-player survival mode tho. The survival mode can be played and beat playing solo as well. Survival mode offers various challenges and unlockable skins that you can use in both modes: campaign and survival.
To be fair then co-op would have made the campaign a bit too easy in this title so it's hardly a con but it's still less content for us since, well, co-op is still optional. I've played through the campaign 1.5 times but i would play through it again if it would have co-op in it.

The gameplay is followed by epic music and cool cartoon/comic styled cutscenes that suit the gameplay well and really add to the overall atmosphere of the game.

Let's narrow it down, shall we?

Pros:
+Fast, smooth and brutal gameplay
+Just the right amount of gore in both gameplay and cutscenes
+Awesome music that fits the game perfectly at all times
+Well done voice acting and animations
+Unlockables that keep you playing the game
+A whole new mode: Survival

Cons:
-No co-op campaign

Overall Shank 2 is an improvement

9/10 - Shank 2 is a must have for every beat 'em up and/or side-scrolling fan.
Read More

Shank 2 brings back good memories about side-scrolling action on NES and Sega Genesis.
Pros:
- Great cartoon graphics;
- High dynamic fights;
- Co-op survival mode.
Cons:
- Short storyline.
P.S. For best experience play with a controller.
